programme.title: 2025 Stanley Cup Playoffs
programme.desc: Carolina gained an early 1-0 lead in the series with a 2-1 overtime win over Washington in Game 1 behind a game-tying goal in the third from Logan Stankoven before a game-winner from Jaccob Slavin; Aliaksei Protas scored for the Capitals.

programme.title: 2025 Stanley Cup Playoffs
programme.desc: Toronto gained the early 1-0 lead in the series with a 5-4 win over defending champion Florida in Game 1 behind two goals and an assist from William Nylander; Sam Bennett scored his fourth goal of the postseason for the Panthers in the loss.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: A panel of reporters from across the country debate trending topics and stories in sports with points being awarded for valid arguments, and at the end of the show, the winner is awarded 30 uninterrupted seconds to discuss any topic of their choice.

programme.title: 2025 Stanley Cup Playoffs
programme.desc: Winnipeg won three of its four regular-season meetings with Dallas after a 4-0 victory on April 10 behind 25 saves from Connor Hellebuyck for his 48th shutout of his career and two goals from Kyle Connor; Josh Morrissey added two assists.

programme.title: Cornhole
programme.desc: The world's top-ranked cornhole players finish out the the ACL Signature #2 and Open #13 at the Arizona Athletic Grounds in Mesa, Arizona for a combined $50,000 in prize money; ACL Pro Teams contest a set of regular season matches.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Joining the list of memorable defense lines with even more memorable nicknames in NFL history, Mark Gastineau, Joe Klecko, Marty Lyons and Abdul Salaam formed one of the most dominant defensive lines in NFL history for the New York Jets in the 1980s.

programme.title: German Bundesliga Soccer
programme.desc: Leipzig claimed a 4-2 victory against Werder Bremen in their first meeting of the season on Jan. 12, led by a first-half brace from Xavi Simons; Benjamin Šeško and Christoph Baumgartner closed out the scoring in the second half of the win.

programme.title: ESPN FC
programme.desc: Network hosts and soccer analysts take an in-depth look at the upcoming games of top-level soccer in Germany, as they discuss performances, interview players and coaches, examine off season moves, and review highlights and up-to-date news.

programme.title: Sportsman's Adventures with Captain Rick Murphy
programme.desc: Captain Rick Murphy, the all-time winningest saltwater tournament angler in the United States, who boats 139 titles to date, goes fishing with a wide variety of passionate anglers in a multitude of thriving fishing holes.

programme.desc: Analysts preview UFC 315 and the main event as Belal Muhammad (24-3) defends his welterweight title against Jack Della Maddalena (17-2); other bouts include: Valentina Shevchenko (24-4-1) defending her flyweight title against Manon Fiorot (12-1-0).

programme.title: Kevin Harvick's Happy Hour
programme.desc: Former NASCAR driver and 2014 Cup Series champion Kevin Harvick and his friends break down the latest news making headlines across NASCAR, going over the latest results and interview guests to gather their unique perspective on the sport.

programme.title: First Things First
programme.desc: Media personalities offer their views and opinions on the day's most intriguing storylines across the world of sports, including debates on the latest issues, analysis of player performances, and discussions on game results and other news.

programme.title: Indycar NICS Racing
programme.desc: Kyle Kirkwood moved into second place and cut his deficit to two-time defending champion Alex Palou to 34 points after winning at Long Beach; Scott McLaughlin won the last two races at Birmingham after averaging 106.38 mph last year.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: San Antonio (1-4) comes off a 27-3 loss to Houston after beating DC, 24-18, but won its meeting with the Stallions last season, 18-9; Birmingham (3-2) had its three-game win streak snapped by Memphis, 24-20, despite two TDs from Case Cookus.

programme.title: The Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show
programme.desc: The FOX Sports team shares coverage of the 2021 Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show as the canine competitors and their owners hope to be crowned the top spot in their respective classes before the coveted Best in Show award is given.

programme.title: Breakfast Ball
programme.desc: Craig Carton, a newly inducted member of the New York State Broadcasters Hall of Fame, joins Chicago sports radio personality Danny Parkins and FOX NFL game analyst Mark Schlereth to discuss the most enticing stories in sports each weekday morning.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
